Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2007 01:03PM clifgoodenough wrote: i just left nova scotia in dec. the woman next door to us found a lump went to the doctor and he said he would get her into a mammogram in 12 months..she was frantic. she drives the bus for an air force base and was taking some recruits into halifax. well she had some time on her hands and went to a doctor's office that had a mammogram. she begged the receptionist to fit her in with no appointment. they had a cancellation so they did one one her. she had breast cancer and had to have her left breast removed immediately. i know i stayed in canada too long. i love it there, but the medical is very bad. they just do not have enough doctors for all the population.......

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2007 09:03AM clifgoodenough wrote: hi... i live in georgia also. i am going thru alot of what you are!!! i am 54, and i also fell awhile back. i have had a breast lump for 4 years, it was diagnosed as nothing to worry about. i just had a mammogram and ultra sound done. they wanted me to have a core biopsy done. i had my records sent from a really good hospital in illinois. the doctor i just had was horrible, he wouldn't even look at the ultra sound the doctor in illinois did, plus he was a "cold fish". didn't want to give me anything for anxiety. well i don't have insurance either. i pondered just forgetting about it, but i finally realize i need to do something!!! i have an appointment with a surgeon here on monday. i am imagining all kinds of things. i only hurt one one side too! my left rib hurts, my chest hurts, i ache, and am tired all the time.. i am driving myself crazy with worry.. where do you live in georgia? i hope all we both are thinking is our imagination running wild....good luck to you.. your friend

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2007 09:45AM clifgoodenough wrote: let me put it this way.. this WHOLE INCIDENT was not in any way my fault. i just moved to the area.. there are 2 hospitals here.. when i went to the general practitioner he gave me a request to go to have my left breast checked. being catholic and being in athens, georgia i chose st. mary's rated NUMBER 1 hospital of the year.. well the doctor there was a real ass.. he was very rough and very uncompassionate.he told me my lymoh nodes were probably involved . i then had to look in a phone book to find a surgeon that would see me. since i had or have no insurance i was turned down on the phone after mentioning i was self pay.. all of a sudden they were COMPLETELY BOOKED.. i found a good doctor went to him and he referred me to Athen's regional hospital, where he said they have a wonderful women's breast care center and a compassionate doctor. he felt under my arm and felt no lymph node involvment. i went there yesterday at 3 and had my robe on that they provided , had taken the ativan and was ready to go thru with the dreaded test. the nurse came in and said the doctor would like to do another ultrasound on my breast. she did it first then the doctor and he commented that this was strange while he was doing it. st. mary's did not send the ultrasound films i had given them from illinois, when i went there, after repeatedly asking them to send them to athen's regional. and the doctor did ask if the doctor at st. mary's had an accent.. so what.. it was fine with me.. he must have had problems with the nut before.. someone needs to pull this idiot's license. i went thru pure hell for almost a month over this.. and yes i am going to trust the doctor i had yesterday.. he wasn't looking for extra money for an unnessisary test...and when i got home my left breast wasn't raw and bruised like the quack doctor i had before....I CAN NOT KEEP RUNNING TO DIFFERENT DOCTOR'S.. THEY SHOULD BE HONEST AND RESPONSIBLE. i am not a millionaire and should not be expected to hunt and supervise educated intelligent doctors...sorry i am so mad.. and now with a few posts of reccommending me go to another one , i'm about ready to jump off the roof!!!!!!!!!!!!@!@!
